normalised: E D Tech Boost: Scholarship Portals Empower Indian Students

unnormalised: **EdTech Boost: Scholarship Portals Empower Indian Students**
normalised: New Delhi, October twenty sixth – Online scholarship portals are rapidly transforming access to higher education for Indian students, particularly those from economically disadvantaged backgrounds. These platforms aggregate information on various scholarships, simplifying the often-complex application process.

unnormalised: New Delhi, October 26 – Online scholarship portals are rapidly transforming access to higher education for Indian students, particularly those from economically disadvantaged backgrounds. These platforms aggregate information on various scholarships, simplifying the often-complex application process.
normalised: According to a recent report by the Ministry of Education, the usage of these portals has increased by forty percent in the last year. Institutions like I I T Madras and Delhi University are actively promoting these resources to their students.

unnormalised: According to a recent report by the Ministry of Education, the usage of these portals has increased by 40% in the last year. Institutions like IIT Madras and Delhi University are actively promoting these resources to their students.
normalised: The "Vidya Dhan" portal, a popular choice amongst students in Kerala, saw a surge in registrations this Onam season. Many families struggling with fees after the festive expenses found relief through scholarships discovered via the portal.

unnormalised: The "Vidya Dhan" portal, a popular choice amongst students in Kerala, saw a surge in registrations this Onam season. Many families struggling with fees after the festive expenses found relief through scholarships discovered via the portal.
normalised: Experts highlight the platforms' ability to connect deserving students with funding opportunities, fostering inclusivity and meritocracy within the Indian education system. From covering tuition fees to providing stipends for research, these portals are becoming an integral part of navigating the financial aspects of pursuing higher education, ensuring bright futures regardless of financial constraints.

unnormalised: Experts highlight the platforms' ability to connect deserving students with funding opportunities, fostering inclusivity and meritocracy within the Indian education system. From covering tuition fees to providing stipends for research, these portals are becoming an integral part of navigating the financial aspects of pursuing higher education, ensuring bright futures regardless of financial constraints.
